title: ICE on Beta when matching on not a tuple variant or struct

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
The following code on latest beta (rustc 1.31.0-beta.17 (1a4f1f398 2018-11-25))
```rust
use std::ffi::OsStr;

fn foo() {
    match Some(OsStr::new("1")) {
        Some(OsStr::new("2")) => (),
    }
}
```
results in ICE
<details>
  <summary>backtrace</summary>

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'expected fn type', libcore\option.rs:1008:5
stack backtrace:
   0: <std::sync::mpsc::select::Select as core::fmt::Debug>::fmt

end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/m
aster/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.31.0-beta.17 (1a4f1f398 2018-11-25) running on x86_64-pc-windows-m
svc

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `osstring`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

</details>

Latest nightly (rustc 1.32.0-nightly (6acbb5b65 2018-11-25)) does not result in ICE.

```
error[E0164]: expected tuple struct/variant, found method `<OsStr>::new`
 --> src\lib.rs:5:14
  |
5 |         Some(OsStr::new("2")) => (),
  |              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ not a tuple variant or struct

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0164`.
error: Could not compile `osstring`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

I would guess whatever fix there was in nightly should be backported to beta/stable as well.

P.s: is not a problem on 1.29.0 stable. Is a problem on 1.30.1
